intro: Velleia paradoxa var. stenoptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf velleia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
